summary: some random ass people on instagram blew up on me for my moomin shipping art and then deleted their comments after like 2...

some random ass people on instagram blew up on me for my moomin shipping art and then deleted their comments after like 2 minutes and they said it was disrespecting tove jansson?!??! 

i have no idea what they were trying to accomplish???

blog.name: squidbiscuit
blog.title: ~Totally Awful All The Time~
blog.description:
Devon, She/Her, Asexual, In a state of sustained fear.
I draw stuff. Blog features material that is almost always tagged appropriately unless I mess something up. 
Commissions are currently [closed] and I do not schedule when they re-open so I cannot give you a time frame for that. Askbox is usually open for doodle suggestions,headcanons, questions, what have you. 
READ BEFORE SENDING MESSAGES!
_Please only suggest things for fandoms I have shown recent interest in. I don't plan out my interests so questions about old fandoms and if I plan to draw for them are not appreciated. I am NEVER looking for new fandoms to get into, please DO NOT suggest new series for me, I promise you I HAVE heard already, I'll mention it on my own if I care. 
FEMALE FOCUS KINK ART IS BY COMMISSION ONLY AND NOT APPRECIATED WHEN SUGGESTED!!!
 ABSOLUTELY NO PERSONAL KINK STORIES! I am massively uncomfortable with irl fetish stories from people.
Even tho I am marked as an NSFW blog I do not enjoy sex based suggestions and would appreciate if you didn't leave them. I do not like pregnancy based kinks at all and I will not draw them or discuss them.Don't ever end a message in "Thanks in advance" because I will not draw for it under implied obligations.
I am not here to teach you the intricacies of my sexuality. If you do not understand it do your own basic research instead of violating the privacy of a complete stranger. I am not my kink, do not treat me as a character.

summary: Remember when Moomin was having a dream about being on Snorks flying machine with Snorkmaiden and his subconscious immediately...
body: Remember when Moomin was having a dream about being on Snorks flying machine with Snorkmaiden and his subconscious immediately replaced her with Snufkin. Like, everyone else is there then too, but Snufkin straight up just replaces her. There’s subconsciously gay.

•Also Joxter and Snufkin fanfics

summary: So I’m fairly new to the Moomin fandom, and I found your blog through ao3, and I wanted to know, why do you like moomin so much?...
question: So I’m fairly new to the Moomin fandom, and I found your blog through ao3, and I wanted to know, why do you like moomin so much? It’s nothing bad, and I like it a lot too. But there’s a lot of different reasons so I’d like to know yours. I love your fanfics by the way, and I can’t wait for the next chapter of the Joxter’s Son!
answer:
Why the Moomin Franchise is so Important To Me

-A short lecture by Macky

Oh boy Anon you’re about to get a nice long answer I’m hope you’re ready.


It’s funny you ask me this, because my brother asked me the same question this past weekend. I was talking about it, raving about every little detail, and he just asked, “Why are you so obsessed with this cartoon?” I just stood there and thought for a second, and never actually gave him a real answer. This wasn’t the first thing he’d seen me obsess over, and as an artist and writer, it definitely won’t be the last.

But like any relating to the Moomin’s, or just cartoons in general, I see it as an escape. Throughout the week, I’m constantly stressing about school and deadlines, things I need to get done, my future and where it will take me. And it’s always nice to have something to go back to, something to calm me down.


There was so much thought and dedication that Tove Jansson put into her work, and you can tell with the uniqueness and personality that every character has. There’s someone everyone can relate to, and no one is left out. If I were to be asked what’s my favorite thing, I wouldn’t be able to answer. The design, the storytelling, the characters. So much makes it into such a wonder work of literature and art.

Whether I’m writing the next chapter of ‘The Joxter’s Son’, or doodling Little My causing chaos, I can take myself out of my current life, and not stress about anything. I put myself into the characters shoes and the I suddenly don’t have to worry about those deadlines or stress about the future.


As someone who’s just reaching adulthood, I think it’s really important to keep holding onto the memories and the things that truly make you happy. I’m not going to school for art or writing like many people on tumblr might be, so it’s good to have those things I can create content for and have people see.


When I first watched The Moomin’s, there was just such a sense of magic and creativity that I can’t find much else anymore, and it made me genuinely happy. And every time I see content from people who love it just as much as I do I get such a huge smile on my face.



So to answer both yours, and my brothers question, I don’t like it, I love it. I love it because I can relate to the characters and feel their emotions whenever I’m reading. I love it because it makes myself and others happy. I love it because it makes me feel like a kid again, and it helps me escape the stress of my life.


Tove Jansson put her heart and soul to create such a memorable and amazing masterpiece, and as a fan, I’ll do my best to keep her creation blossoming.


Sorry for the long answer, but I’ve seen a lot of people asking similar questions about what all the hype is about and whether it’s worth watching. Here’s a quick summary why.



(Thanks for asking and I’m glad you like my fanfics and blog!)
